items.title: Raya transformeert in Stekelenburg: 'E√©n van de beste reddingen van het seizoen'
items.summary: Arsenal won zaterdagavond dan wel van Brighton & Hove Albion , maar makkelijk ging dat allerminst. The Gunners hadden geluk dat David Raya scherp was. Alan Shearer en Mikel Arteta genoten van de Spanjaard. 'E√©n van de beste reddingen van het seizoen.'

items.title: Afrika Cup, Premier League en meer: lees hier alles terug van het zaterdagvoetbal
items.summary: Goedendag en welkom in de VI Live van zaterdag 27 december. Hopelijk had u een fijne kerstperiode, en bent u klaar voor een fraaie dag vol voetbal. In dit blog hoeft u niks te missen van mooie affiches in onder meer Itali√´, Engeland en Marokko.

items.title: Nigeria overleeft zinderend einde en plaatst zich voor knock-outfase Afrika Cup
items.summary: Nigeria is zeker van de knock-outfase van de Afrika Cup. The Super Eagles maakten het zaterdag nog enorm spannend tegen Tunesi√´, maar mochten na negentig minuten toch drie punten bijschrijven. Omdat Oeganda en Tanzania elkaar eerder op de avond nog in evenwicht hielden, hoeven ook de Tunesi√´rs nog niet te vrezen

items.title: Watkins brace seals Villa an 11th consecutive win
items.summary: Aston Villa's remarkable winning run continued as Ollie Watkins came off the bench in the second half to score twice and earn a valuable 2-1 victory over Chelsea.

items.title: Slot: Wirtz 'relieved' after Liverpool goal
items.summary: Arne Slot has described Florian Wirtz display in Liverpool's 2-1 victory over Wolverhampton Wanderers as "special".

items.title: Arteta warns Arsenal's composure must improve
items.summary: Mikel Arteta has warned that Arsenal must show more composure to close out games after his team secured a nervy 2-1 win over Brighton on Saturday.

items.title: Juventus komt laat op gang, maar wint Buffon-derby in de Serie A
items.summary: Juventus kwam zaterdagavond laat op gang tegen Pisa. De Oude Dame had alle moeite met de promovendus, maar wist het duel in de slotfase naar zich toe te trekken.

items.title: For a team topping the Premier League table, Arsenal haven't looked convincing enough
items.summary: Arsenal relied on an own goal for their fourth straight match, and it's not as convincing as it should be from the team topping the Premier League.

items.title: Who should everyone else worry about? Aston Villa, the Premier League's hottest team
items.summary: Aston Villa are on a historic hot streak, and they can absolutely challenge for the Premier League title.

items.title: Opponent joins in with Bunting's ICONIC walk-on song!
items.summary: Alexandra Palace goes wild as Stephen Bunting arrives in style with his iconic 'Titanium' walk-on song.

items.title: Slot blikt terug op emotionele Jota-dag: 'Engelse fans zijn speciaal'
items.summary: Arne Slot heeft een groot compliment gemaakt aan de fans van Liverpool, maar ook aan die van Wolverhampton Wanderers. De Nederlandse manager vond het heel speciaal hoe de Engelse fans Diogo Jota eerden.

items.title: Monolithic belief of Guardiolismo has fractured in new era for tactics | Jonathan Wilson
items.summary: The old ways are over and nobody is entirely sure what is to follow but football revolutions once experienced are never forgotten If you want a picture of the future, imagine Michael Kayode winding up to take a long throw ‚Äì forever. Or at least that was how it seemed in October. Already, though, the picture has begun to change. This was the year of the backlash, and then a bit of a backlash to the backlash. For almost two decades football had accepted the guardiolista consensus. Football was about possession, about the press, but most of all about position, about the careful manipulation of space. Much-improved pitches meant first touches could be taken for granted: players receiving the ball didn‚Äôt have to focus on getting it under control but could instead be parsing their options. The game had become chess with a ball, a matter of strategy more than physicality. Continue reading...

items.title: Schade fires hat-trick as Brentford thrash Bournemouth
items.summary: Kevin Schade scores a hat-trick as Brentford beat Bournemouth 4-1.

items.title: Wirtz scores first Liverpool goal in victory against Wolves
items.summary: Liverpool score twice within a minute as Florian Wirtz scores his first goal for his side to beat Wolverhampton Wanderers 2-1.

items.title: Cherki stars in late Manchester City win against Nottingham Forest
items.summary: Rayan Cherki assists in the first half and scores late in the second for Manchester City to beat Nottingham Forest 2-1 and get their sixth Premier League win in a row.

items.title: Arsenal return to top of table with win over Brighton
items.summary: Arsenal return to the top of the table with Martin Odegaard scoring his first Premier League goal of the season to beat Brighton 2-1.

items.title: Watkins double fires Aston Villa to stunning win at Chelsea
items.summary: Substitute Ollie Watkins fires a second-half double as Aston Villa fight back from a goal down to beat Chelsea at Stamford Bridge.

items.title: Ollie Watkins‚Äô double off the bench gives Aston Villa comeback victory at Chelsea
items.summary: Unai Emery had to tear up the plan. Aston Villa had started this game in a compact 4-2-2-2 formation but they were desperate for much of the first hour. Their passing was lethargic, they had no width, they were 1-0 down to a dominant Chelsea and it seemed the story was going to centre on Emery‚Äôs decision not to start Ollie Watkins up front. Yet few managers are as effective as Emery when it comes to altering the flow with a few smart tweaks. The Spaniard never stops plotting, never stops hunting for weaknesses in his opponents, and perhaps it was not a surprise when Villa‚Äôs tactical mastermind found a way to ensure that the travelling fans were belting out songs about winning the league at full time. Continue reading...

items.title: Unstoppable! Villa make it ELEVEN wins in a row at stunned Stamford Bridge
items.summary: Highlights from the Premier League clash between Chelsea and Aston Villa.
